description:
Rhinopithecus bieti, also known as the Yunnan snub-nosed monkey or the black snub-nosed monkey, is a species of primate in the Colobinae subfamily of Old World monkeys. It is found in the mountainous regions of northwestern Yunnan and southeastern Tibet in China, at elevations ranging from 3,000 to 4,500 meters.

The Rhinopithecus bieti is a large, robust monkey with a distinctive upturned nose and long, flowing black or dark grey fur. It has a large, rounded head, a short muzzle, and large, expressive eyes. The species is arboreal and primarily folivorous, feeding on leaves, shoots, and fruits.

Rhinopithecus bieti lives in large, cohesive social groups, typically comprising several adult males, adult females, and their offspring. The groups are known for their complex social dynamics and communication, utilizing a variety of vocalizations and facial expressions.

The species is considered endangered due to habitat loss, fragmentation, and hunting. Conservation efforts, including the establishment of protected areas and eco-tourism initiatives, are ongoing to ensure the survival of this unique primate species.
